subject: Critical Thinking
subcategory: Evidence & Truth: How We Know What's Real
title: The Limits of Empiricism
description: A quick win: understand The Limits of Empiricism.

hook.text: David Hume woke up one morning and realized he couldn't prove the sun would rise.

buildup.text: Empiricism says all knowledge comes from experience. But experience only tells us what has happened, not what must.

discovery.text: The problem of induction: no amount of observed sunrises logically guarantees the next one.

twist.text: Science relies on induction daily â€” yet Hume showed it has no logical foundation. We trust patterns, not proofs.

climax.text: Karl Popper's solution: we can't prove theories true, only falsify them. Science advances by elimination.

punchline.text: Every sunrise is an act of faith in patterns.

quiz.question: What is the 'problem of induction' identified by Hume?
options: Past observations can't logically guarantee future outcomes
